Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4 restructuring

Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> 
> That's a completely separate debate and in my experience, closed source
> software is usually much better at publishing and maintaining API's than
> open-source (Microsoft being a pretty good example), but let's save this for
> another day.

On this, I guess our experiences really do differ. I work hardly at all 
with Microsoft APIs, but in the Java world, the open source stuff tends 
to be as well or better documented than the proprietary stuff. Sure 
there's a lot of poorly documented, poorly written open source software, 
but this tends to sink to the bottom and fall out of use pretty quickly. 
The libraries people actually use are much better documented than their 
proprietary equivalents. (Probably effect rather than cause, but either 
way...) I suspect it also matters that one of the easiest ways for 
someone to contribute to a project is to start writing some 
documentation patches. This means open source documentation tends to 
improve with time. Proprietary documentation rarely does.

Perhaps the Microsoft universe is different though.



--
